page.title: 10LONGDEN VILLAGE
page.content: Longden is the main village which serves the area but is just outside the survey region.The village centre is around three sides of a crossroad. The Post Office is the focal point of the village and is also the village shop.It has been in its present position since 1974 and meets most of the purchasing needs of the area.There is also a public house called 'The Tankerville' named after a famous local family which made its fortune from lead mining in the nineteenth century. There is also a church which is Anglican and a church school whose catchment area includes all the survey area except the vicinity of Dorrington. The village hall and playing fields is in memory of Sir Douglas Swire.
